page.title: 01HALLATON - SLAWSTON - CRANOE
page.content: Our 12 sq km block is a fairly remote, picturesque and sparsely populated part of south-east Leicestershire. The area is mostly rich agricultural land, with three centres of population: the villages of Hallaton (pop 400) and Slawston (pop 81), and the hamlet of Cranoe (pop 32). They are still basically rural communities, although there is a slow influx of commuters. The area contains a broad spectrum of people, ranging from farm workers in charity cottages to company directors in large period houses. Community life centres broadly around Church activities, and in Hallaton around the Sports and Social Club and pubs as well. In summary, it is an extremely pleas- ant corner of England, untouched by many of the problems and attitudes of modern urban life.
